Package driver_framework.response

Enum Class Response

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Response>
driver_framework.response.Response
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Response>, Constable
public enum Response extends Enum<Response>
Response form has 2 types: Response field -> | Response | Body field -> | BODY | | Response | BODY | 1 4 | Response | BODY | 1 n -> n represents variables length of body, this is crucial when writing sensor's data into client's input stream each response contains of 5 bytes 1^st byte represents response type following 4 bytes represent additional response data. Some responses will use this space, some will leave it empty. For example: Response type: CONFIGURE_Y [CONFIGURE_Y.byteValue, -, -, -, - ] -> informs that it can get number of bytes requested in CONFIGURE request. Response type: IS_CONNECTED_Y [IS_CONNECTED_Y.byteValue, -, -, -, - ] Response type: START_READING_Y [ START_READING_Y.byteValue, 0, 0, 0, 0b0000_0100 ] -> informs that reading started and that each time it will send 4 bytes Response type: READING [ READING.byteValue, x, x, x, x, ... , n^th 'x' byte ] etc.

  • Enum Constant Summary

    Enum Constants
    Enum Constant
    Description
    CONFIGURE_N
    Request = | CONFIGURE | sensor_id | sample rate ( 4 bytes ) Response = | CONNECT_N | sensor_id
    CONFIGURE_Y
    Request = | CONFIGURE | sensor_id | sample rate ( 4 bytes ) Response = | CONNECT_Y | - - - - |
    CONNECT_N
    Request = | CONNECT | - - - - | Response = | CONNECT_N | - - - - | problem with establishing communication
    CONNECT_SENSOR_N
    Request = | CONNECT_SENSOR | SENSOR_TYPE(1 byte) | this response is given if Sensor_type is not registered / present on the board.
    CONNECT_SENSOR_Y
    Request = | CONNECT_SENSOR | SENSOR_TYPE(1 byte) - - - | this response is given if Sensor_type is registered / present on the board.
    CONNECT_Y
    Request = | CONNECT | - - - - | Response = | CONNECT_Y | n sensors | (sensorPackage - id + sensor type)
    DISCONNECT_SENSOR_N
    Request = | DISCONNECT_SENSOR | if sensor exists and is connected, response is positive, otherwise negative Response = | DISCONNECT_SENSOR_N | sensor id |
    DISCONNECT_SENSOR_Y
    Request = | DISCONNECT_SENSOR | if sensor exists and is connected, response is positive, otherwise negative Response = | DISCONNECT_SENSOR_Y | sensor id |
    INVALID_REQUEST
    Request = 'ANY' Informs that one sending the request is not following framework's conventions and sends the rejected request type alongside with the response.
    IS_CONNECTED_N
    Request = | IS_CONNECTED | response given if remote mobile device hasn't previously connected Response = | IS_CONNECTED_N | - - - - |
    IS_CONNECTED_Y
    Request = | IS_CONNECTED | response given if remote mobile device has previously connected and informs about which sensor connected Response = | IS_CONNECTED_N | SENSOR_TYPE(1 byte) - - - |
    READING_SENSOR_DATA
    Request = none -> this response sent only while data is being read from the sensor Informs that reading is in progress, and sends read data along with it.
    START_READ_N
    Request = | START_READ | - - - - | This response is given if data is available for reading.
    START_READ_Y
    Request = | START_READ | - - - - | This response is given if data is available for reading.
    STOP_READ_N
    Request = | STOP_READ | response informs that that pausing reading was not possible, this may be due to some system error / unresponsivenes Response = | STOP_READ_N | - - - - |
    STOP_READ_Y
    Request = | STOP_READ | response informs that reading paused ( ideally, this will almost always execute ) Response = | STOP_READ_Y | - - - - |

    • READING_SENSOR_DATA

      public static final Response READING_SENSOR_DATA
      Request = none -> this response sent only while data is being read from the sensor Informs that reading is in progress, and sends read data along with it. # of bytes read / written depends on sensor's data type, or configuration Response = | READING_SENSOR_DATA | x, x, x, x, ... , n^th 'x' byte |

    • INVALID_REQUEST

      public static final Response INVALID_REQUEST
      Request = 'ANY' Informs that one sending the request is not following framework's conventions and sends the rejected request type alongside with the response. Response = | INVALID_REQUEST | REQUEST(1 byte) - - - |
